Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……说来，………这小子，…明明自称不懂魔法，其力量却颇为不俗。……原来如此，该说他不愧是金藏的孙子么…？」

Umineko Project (UP): The strong power pouring from George was even large enough to pass as magical power.
Steam (ST): The strong energy pouring from George was large enough to act as magical power.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The strong power pouring from George was large enough to act as magical power.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治より注がれる強い力は、魔力としても通じるほどの大きなもの。
Russian (RU): Огромной силы, исходящей из Джорджа, было вполне достаточно, чтобы использовать её в качестве силы магии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O forte poder que exalava de George era forte o suficiente para se passar por poder mágico.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從讓治身上注入的強大力量，是可以作為魔力使用的巨大力量。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从让治身上注入的强大力量，是可以作为魔力使用的巨大力量。

Umineko Project (UP): ...At first, Beato thought it was due to the blood of the mage Kinzo.
Steam (ST): ...At first, Beato thought it must be the blood of Kinzo, the sorceror.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...At first, Beato thought it was due to the blood of the magician Kinzo.
PC Japanese (JP): …ベアトは初め、それは魔術師であった金蔵の血によるものだろうと思った。
Russian (RU): ...Сперва Беато полагала, что это именно благодаря крови мага Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Momentaneamente, Beato pensou que era devido a relação de sangue com o mago Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …貝阿朵剛開始以為，這大概是出於身為魔術師的金藏的血脈。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …贝阿朵刚开始以为，这大概是出于身为魔术师的金藏的血脉。

Umineko Project (UP): ......However, that was probably wrong.{n}...She had a feeling that Battler had taught her that.
Steam (ST): ...However, that probably wasn't it. ...She had a feeling that Battler had already told her what it was.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......However, that was probably wrong....She had a feeling that Battler had taught her that.
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、多分、それは違う。…戦人に、それを教えられたような気がする。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……しかし、多分、それは違う。{n}…戦人に、それを教えられたような気がする。
Russian (RU): ......Однако, быть может, это было и не так.{n}...У неё было ощущение, что Баттлер научил её этому.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Entretanto, isto provavelmente estava errado.{n}...Ela havia um sentimento que Battler a havia ensinado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過，多半並非如此。{n}…貝阿朵感覺，戰人好像告訴過她這個。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过，多半并非如此。{n}…贝阿朵感觉，战人好像告诉过她这个。

Umineko Project (UP): George's power to feel sorrow for the death of his loved one......arose from the way he had tried his hardest throughout his life, from the warm time spent together with Shannon, and from the size of their shared dream, promising each other their futures.
Steam (ST): It had been born from the power of George's sadness at the death of the person he loved, ...and from the way he had tried his hardest throughout his life, from the warm time spent together with Shannon, to the size of the dream they swore to protect in the future.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It had been born from the power of George's sadness at the death of the person he loved, ......and from the way he had tried his hardest throughout his life, from the warm time spent together with Shannon, and the size of the dream they swore to protect in the future.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治の、想い人の死を悲しむ力は、……それまでの彼の一生懸命だった人生と、紗音との温かな時間、そして将来を誓い合った夢の大きさから生まれるのだ。
Russian (RU): Эта сила была рождена из печали Джорджа от потери своей возлюбленной... А также из упорных стараний, прилагаемых им в течение всей его жизни, из тёплых моментов, проведённых вместе с Шаннон, и той необъятной мечты, которую они поклялись защитить в будущем.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O poder que nasceu da tristeza que George sentia pela morte daquela que ele amava......surgindo a partir do caminho que ele havia percorrido fazendo o seu máximo durante sua vida, até os calorosos momentos que ele passou com Shannon, e também os imensuráveis sonhos que compartilhavam, prometendo um ao outro seus futuros.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治那哀心上人之死的悲傷之力，……是從他一直以來奮力經營的人生，與紗音共度的溫情時光，以及與紗音共誓的將來的巨大夢想中誕生的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治那哀心上人之死的悲伤之力，……是从他一直以来奋力经营的人生，与纱音共度的温情时光，以及与纱音共誓的将来的巨大梦想中诞生的。

Umineko Project (UP): Do humans really live this seriously during their one single life?
Steam (ST): Is it really possible for humans to take life so seriously, even though they only have a single one?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Are humans able to live this seriously during only one single life?
PC Japanese (JP): 人は、たったひとつの命に、ここまでも真剣に生きるものなのか。
Russian (RU): Способны ли люди жить так серьёзно на протяжении своей одной единственной жизни?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Podem os humanos realmente viver de forma tão séria durante suas únicas vidas?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 人，在唯一的生命中，是如此拚命、認真地活著的嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 人，在唯一的生命中，是如此拼命、认真地活着的吗？

Umineko Project (UP): ......Of course they do. To her, a life didn't mean anything more than the difference between the top and bottom of an Othello piece.
Steam (ST): ...It was only natural. To her, a life didn't mean anything more than the difference between the top and bottom of an Othello piece.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Of course they could. To her, a life didn't mean anything more than the difference between the top and bottom of an Othello piece.
PC Japanese (JP): ……当然だ。自分にとって命というものは、オセロの表と裏程度の意味しかない。
Russian (RU): ......Разумеется, способны. Для неё сама жизнь значила не больше, чем разница между белыми и чёрными фишками в Реверси.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......É claro que podem. Para ela, uma vida não significa nada mais do que a diferença entre a parte superior e inferior de uma peça de Othello.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……當然的事。對自己來說，生命這種東西，僅有著黑白棋正反面程度的意義。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……当然的事。对自己来说，生命这种东西，仅有着黑白棋正反面程度的意义。

Umineko Project (UP): If the black represented death, then she thought all you had to do was flip it over again and make it white.
Steam (ST): If the black represented death, then she thought all you had to do was flip it over again and make it white.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If the black represented death, then she thought all you had to do was flip it over again and make it white.
PC Japanese (JP): 黒が死を示すなら、また裏返して白にすればいいだけのものとしか思わなかった。
Russian (RU): Если чёрная олицетворяла смерть, то она полагала, что необходимо лишь снова перевернуть её и сделать белой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se o preto representa a morte, por consequente, ela pensava que tudo o que você precisava fazer era virar novamente deixando‐a branca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只是單純以為，如果黑代表死的話，那麼只用把它翻到白就行了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只是单纯以为，如果黑代表死的话，那么只用把它翻到白就行了。

Umineko Project (UP): However, it was just like that broken vase.
Steam (ST): However, it was just like that broken vase.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, it was just like that broken vase.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、あの割れた壷と同じ。
Russian (RU): Тем не менее, это было так же, как и разбить ту вазу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, era apenas como uma vaso quebrado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，這就如那摔碎了的壺一樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，这就如那摔碎了的壶一样。

Umineko Project (UP): ......To humans in a world without magic, where they can never return it to its original form, ......it is very, very natural for them to bet all their body and soul on that single life.
Steam (ST): ...To humans in a world without magic, where they cannot return things to their original form, ...it is very, very natural for them to bet their life and soul.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......To humans in a world without magic, where they cannot return it to its original form, ......it is very, very natural for them to bet their life and soul.
PC Japanese (JP): ……二度と元の姿に戻せない、魔法のない世界の人間ならば、……そのたったひとつの命に、全身全霊を賭けるのは、とてもとても当り前なことなのだ。
Russian (RU): ......Для людей в мире без магии, где они не могут вернуться к изначальной форме... Очень и очень естественно ставить на кон жизнь и душу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Para humanos em um mundo sem magia, onde eles nunca poderiam retornar às suas verdadeiras formas, ......era deveras natural para eles apostarem seus corpos e almas por completo em uma única vida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……身處無法變回原樣的，沒有魔法的世界的人類，……把全身心賭在唯一的生命上，是非常非常理所當然的事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……身处无法变回原样的，没有魔法的世界的人类，……把全身心赌在唯一的生命上，是非常非常理所当然的事。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): ".........So there are times when an Endless Witch, with full command over even life and death, ......is inferior to a finite {y:0:Human}{n:0:human}, for whom even death's mountain is impossible to cross......?"
Steam (ST): "......So, is an Endless Witch, who can do as she pleases even with life and death... inferior to a limited Human who can't even surpass the mountain of death...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Is an Endless Witch, who can do as she wants even with life and death, ......inferior to a limited human who can't even surpass the mountain of death......?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………生死すら自在にする無限の魔女が、……死の山さえ越えられぬ有限のニンゲンに、劣ることもあるというのか……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………生死すら自在にする無限の魔女が、……死の山さえ越えられぬ有限のニンゲンに、劣ることもあるというのか……」
Russian (RU): ".........Означает ли это, что Ведьма Бесконечности, во власти которой находятся сами жизнь и смерть... Уступает даже ограниченным {y:0:Люд}{n:0:люд}ям, которые не в силах перешагнуть гору смерти?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Por isso havia diversos momentos em que uma Bruxa do Infinito, com total controle até mesmo sobre a vida e a morte, ......era inferior a um finito {y:0:Humano}{n:0:humano}, para o qual era impossível cruzar a montanha da morte......?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………連生死都能自由操縱的無限的魔女，……竟也有遜色於，連死之山都翻越不了的有限人類之處嗎……？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………连生死都能自由操纵的无限的魔女，……竟也有逊色于，连死之山都翻越不了的有限人类之处吗……？」

Umineko Project (UP): Now, the witch acknowledged it.
Steam (ST): This time, the witch acknowledged it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): This time, the witch acknowledged it.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女は、今こそ認める。
Russian (RU): На этот раз ведьма признала это.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A bruxa agora reconhece isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女在此刻認同了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女在此刻认同了。

Umineko Project (UP): He was able to hold a magical power that could not reside in witches who didn't understand the value of a life.
Steam (ST): He was able to hold a magical power that could never reside in witches who didn't understand the value of a life.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He was able to hold a magical power that could not reside in witches who didn't understand the value of a life.
PC Japanese (JP): 命の価値を理解できない魔女には宿せない魔力を、彼は持ち得ている。
Russian (RU): Ему оказалось под силу освободить силу магии, которой не оказалось у ведьмы, не понимавшей ценности жизни.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele foi capaz de reunir um poder mágico incapaz de residir dentro de bruxas que não compreendiam o valor de uma vida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 認同了，他具有著不懂生命價值的魔女所無法宿有的魔力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 认同了，他具有着不懂生命价值的魔女所无法宿有的魔力。

Umineko Project (UP): ......What is this thing called the Endless Magic {i:for} again?
Steam (ST): ...Why does this thing called the Endless Magic exist?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Why does this thing called the Endless Magic exist?
PC Japanese (JP): ……無限の魔法とは、何のためにあるんだったか。
Russian (RU): ......Почему существует явление, зовущееся магией бесконечности?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Aquela que era chamada Magia do Infinito agora {i:servia} para quê?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……無限之魔法，是為何而存在的呢？
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……无限之魔法，是为何而存在的呢？

Umineko Project (UP): ...Even though I call myself the Endless Witch, have I been forgetting what the Endless Magic means...for a whole thousand years.........?
Steam (ST): ...Even though I called myself the Endless Witch, did I forget what the Endless Magic means for a thousand years......?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Even though I called myself the Endless Witch, did I forget what the Endless Magic means for one thousand years.........?
PC Japanese (JP): …妾は、無限の魔女を名乗りながら、無限の魔法の意味を、…千年間も忘れていたのではないのか………。
Russian (RU): ...Хоть я и называю себя Ведьмой Бесконечности, позабыла ли я истинное значение магии бесконечности за тысячу лет?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Mesmo que me proclame a Bruxa do Infinito, teria eu esquecido o significado da Magia do Infinito...durante esses mil anos.........?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …妾身雖自稱無限的魔女，但在千年間，連無限魔法的意義，…都給忘了………。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …妾身虽自称无限的魔女，但在千年间，连无限魔法的意义，…都给忘了………。

Umineko Project (UP): She looked at George's expression again. .........His surging earnestness was like a lightning bolt.
Steam (ST): She looked at George's expression again. ......His surging earnestness was like a lightning bolt.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She looked at George's expression again..........His surging earnestness was like a lightning bolt.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治の表情を改めて見る。………迸る真剣さは稲妻のよう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 譲治の表情を改めて見る。……迸る真剣さは稲妻のよう。
Russian (RU): Она снова взглянула на выражение Джорджа. .........Его предельная серьёзность обжигала подобно молнии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela olhou para a expressão de George mais uma vez. .........A devoção que ele manifestava era como um trovão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 再一看讓治的表情。………其迸發的認真勁，猶如閃電。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 再一看让治的表情。………其迸发的认真劲，犹如闪电。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Right now, even if George's body was burned, or smashed by a waterfall, he would probably continue to pray for his beloved without minding it, without noticing it.
Steam (ST): ...Right now, even if George's body had been burned or smashed by a waterfall, he would probably continue to pray for his beloved without minding it, without noticing it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Right now, even if George's body was burned or smashed by a waterfall, he would probably continue to pray for his beloved without minding it, without noticing it.
PC Japanese (JP): …今の譲治なら、たとえその身を焼かれようとも、滝に打たれようとも、気にもせず、気付きもせず、愛する者への祈りを続けるだろう。
Russian (RU): ...Прямо сейчас, даже если бы Джорджа обжёг огонь или на него бы обрушился водопад, он бы, возможно, по‐прежнему продолжал молиться за любимую, не отвлекаясь и не замечая этого.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Agora, mesmo que o corpo de George fosse queimado ou esmagado por uma cachoeira, ele certamente continuaria a orar por sua amada sem se importar, sem notar absolutamente nada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …對此刻的讓治而言，即便是烈火焚身、瀑布擊頂，也會毫不分心，渾然不知地，繼續為深愛之人獻上祈禱吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …对此刻的让治而言，即便是烈火焚身、瀑布击顶，也会毫不分心，浑然不知地，继续为深爱之人献上祈祷吧。

Umineko Project (UP): For the first time, ...she showed respect for that power.
Steam (ST): For the first time, ...she showed respect for that power.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): For the first time, ...she showed respect for that power.
PC Japanese (JP): 魔女は初めて、…その力に敬意を表した。
Russian (RU): В первый раз... ведьма почувствовала уважение к этой силе.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pela primeira vez, ...ela demonstrou respeito por aquele poder.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 魔女首次對，…這份力量表達了敬意。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 魔女首次对，…这份力量表达了敬意。

Umineko Project (UP): So in that instant, all magical resistance was lost, and the enormous power of George's feelings turned into magical power in its perfect form......
Steam (ST): So in that instant, all magical resistance was lost, and the enormous power of George's feelings turned into magical energy in its complete form...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So in that instant, all magical resistance was lost, and the enormous power of George's feelings turned into magical power in its perfect form......
PC Japanese (JP): だからその瞬間、全ての魔法抵抗が失われ、譲治の膨大な想いの力が完全な形で魔力に変換される……。
Russian (RU): Таким образом, в этот момент все анти‐магические противодействия разом исчезли, и огромная сила чувств Джорджа превратилась в силу магии во всей своей совершенной форме...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, em um instante, toda a resistência mágica foi perdida, e o imenso poder dos sentimentos de George se transformaram em poder mágico em sua forma perfeita......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，在這一瞬間，所有魔法抵抗全部消失，讓治龐大的思念之力以完全的形式變換為了魔力……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，在这一瞬间，所有魔法抵抗全部消失，让治庞大的思念之力以完全的形式变换为了魔力……。

Umineko Project (UP): The vase was very, very beautiful, rich with history and value.
Steam (ST): The vase was very beautiful, rich with history and value.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The vase was very beautiful, rich with history and value.
PC Japanese (JP): それは、とてもとても美しくて、価値と歴史のある素晴らしい壷でした。
Russian (RU): Ваза была прекрасной, имела богатую историю и огромную ценность.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era um vaso muito, muito belo, rico em história e valor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是一件，非常非常漂亮，歷史與價值兼備的，華美的壺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是一件，非常非常漂亮，历史与价值兼备的，华美的壶。

Umineko Project (UP): Even as young as I was, it still forced me to take a deep breath when I witnessed its beauty. ......But that just made me want to touch it.
Steam (ST): Even as young as I was, it still forced me to take a deep breath when I witnessed its beauty. ...But that just made me want to touch it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even as young as I was, it still forced me to take a deep breath when I witnessed its beauty.......But that just made me want to touch it.
PC Japanese (JP): 幼い私が見ても、その美しさにため息が堪えられないほどに。……でも、だから触れてみたかったのです。
Russian (RU): И хотя я была очень юна, у меня дух захватывало от зрелища её красоты. ......Однако запрет только распалил моё желание потрогать её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo sendo jovem, eu ainda me sentia obrigada a suspirar toda vez que testemunhava sua beleza. ......Mas isso apenas fazia eu querer tocá‐lo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 即便是幼小的我看到後，都不得不為它的這份美發出感嘆之聲。……但是，正因如此，才好想摸摸看。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 即便是幼小的我看到后，都不得不为它的这份美发出感叹之声。……但是，正因如此，才好想摸摸看。

Umineko Project (UP): But the vase easily fell and smashed into smithereens.
Steam (ST): But the vase easily fell and smashed into pieces.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But the vase easily fell and smashed into pieces.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、壷はあっさりと落ちて割れて粉々に。
Russian (RU): Но ваза с лёгкостью упала и разбилась на куски.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas o vaso facilmente caiu e se despedaçou em cacos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，壺一碰就掉了下來，摔得粉碎。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，壶一碰就掉了下来，摔得粉碎。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Like a popped bubble, it felt as though the time when it had possessed a form was just an illusion.
Steam (ST): ...Like a bubble that had popped, it felt as though the time it possessed a form had been just an illusion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...Like it was a bubble that had popped, it felt as though the time when it had possessed a form was just an illusion.
PC Japanese (JP): …割れてしまったシャボン玉がそうであるように、形あった時のそれがまるで幻であったかのように感じてしまう。
Russian (RU): ...Это напоминало лопнувший пузырь, казалось, будто время, когда та имела форму, было лишь иллюзией.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Como uma bolha que estourou, fazendo parecer que o tempo em que ele possuía uma forma era meramente uma ilusão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …就跟爆裂的肥皂泡一樣，令人感覺，有形時的它，有如一場虛幻。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …就跟爆裂的肥皂泡一样，令人感觉，有形时的它，有如一场虚幻。

Umineko Project (UP): It was that fragile, ......that easily lost, that life.
Steam (ST): Lives are just that fragile, just that easily...lost.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Lives are that fragile, that easily, ......lost.
PC Japanese (JP): それくらいにあっさりと儚く、……失われてしまった、命。
Russian (RU): Жизнь такая хрупкая, такая невесомая... исчезает.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era frágil, ......fácil de se perder, como uma vida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如此乾脆無常地，……失去了生命。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如此干脆无常地，……失去了生命。

Umineko Project (UP): I realized that, because of my own foolish curiosity, I had done something that couldn't be taken back.
Steam (ST): I realized that my foolish curiosity had led to something that couldn't be undone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I realized that my foolish curiosity had caused something that couldn't be taken back.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は、自らの愚かな好奇心が取り返しのつかないことをしてしまったことを悟りました。
Russian (RU): Я осознала, что, поддавшись глупому любопытству, совершила нечто необратимое.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu percebi que, por causa da minha tola curiosidade, havia cometido algo que não poderia ser desfeito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我意識到了，自己那愚蠢的好奇心犯下了無法挽回之錯。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我意识到了，自己那愚蠢的好奇心犯下了无法挽回之错。

Umineko Project (UP): No matter how much I regretted it, no matter how much I apologized.{n}The broken vase would not return to its original form...{n}A lost life will not return to normal no matter what happens.
Steam (ST): No matter how much I regretted it, no matter how much I apologized. The smashed vase wouldn't return back to its original form... A lost life will not return to normal no matter what happens.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No matter how much I regretted it, no matter how much I apologized. The smashed vase wouldn't return back to its original form... A lost life will not return to normal no matter what happens.
PC Japanese (JP): いくら後悔しても、いくら謝っても。砕けてしまった壷は元の姿に戻ってはくれません…。失われた命は、どのようなことがあっても、元に戻らない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): いくら後悔しても、いくら謝っても。{n}砕けてしまった壷は元の姿に戻ってはくれません…。{n}失われた命は、どのようなことがあっても、元に戻らない。
Russian (RU): Сколько бы я ни сожалела, сколько бы ни извинялась.{n}Разбитой вазе было не суждено обрести прежнюю форму...{n}Потерянная жизнь не вернётся обратно, что бы ни случилось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não importava o quanto eu me arrependesse, não importava o quanto eu me desculpasse.{n}O vaso quebrado não iria retornar à sua forma original...{n}Uma vida perdida não irá retornar não importa o que aconteça.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不管怎麼後悔，不管怎麼道歉。{n}摔碎了的壺都不會變回原來的樣子…。{n}失去的生命，是無論如何都不會復甦的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不管怎么后悔，不管怎么道歉。{n}摔碎了的壶都不会变回原来的样子…。{n}失去的生命，是无论如何都不会复苏的。

Umineko Project (UP): I was frightened by the fact that my own frivolous action, even though it had been frivolous, ...had stolen a life that could never be revived again.
Steam (ST): I was frightened that, even though my actions had been thoughtless and careless, ...they had stolen away a life that could never be revived again.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I was frightened that even though my careless actions had been thoughtless, ...they had stolen a life that would never be revived again.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は自らの軽率な行為が、軽率であるにもかかわらず、…二度と蘇れない形で命を奪ってしまうことに恐怖しました。
Russian (RU): Я испугалась, что даже если мои неосторожные действия были бездумными... они всё равно украли жизнь, которая больше никогда не сможет вернуться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu estava apavorada que meu ato pueril, mesmo tendo sido algo frívolo, ...havia roubado uma vida que jamais poderia ser revivida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我為自己輕率的行為，雖是出於輕率的一念之差，…卻也以再也無法復甦的形式奪走了生命，而感到了恐懼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我为自己轻率的行为，虽是出于轻率的一念之差，…却也以再也无法复苏的形式夺走了生命，而感到了恐惧。

Umineko Project (UP): And, out of pity for the lost life, I cried.{n}Out of fear of myself, who had made it become lost, I cried even more.
Steam (ST): Then, I pitied that lost life and cried. I was frightened of myself, the one responsible for its loss, and cried even more.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, I pitied the lost life, and cried. I was frightened of myself, who had made it become lost, and cried even more.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、失われた命を哀れんで、泣きました。失わせた自らに恐怖して、さらに泣きました。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そして、失われた命を哀れんで、泣きました。{n}失わせた自らに恐怖して、さらに泣きました。
Russian (RU): Тогда мне стало жаль потерянную жизнь и я заплакала.{n}Я испугалась за себя, заставившую её исчезнуть, и заплакала ещё сильнее.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E, aterrorizada pela vida que foi perdida, eu chorei.{n}Com medo de mim mesma, quem o fez perder sua vida, eu chorei ainda mais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，為失去的生命感到哀傷，哭了。{n}因為對令其喪命的自己感到害怕，哭得更厲害了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，为失去的生命感到哀伤，哭了。{n}因为对令其丧命的自己感到害怕，哭得更厉害了。

Umineko Project (UP): I was sure that Grandfather would also cry at the loss of his precious vase.
Steam (ST): I'm sure Grandfather will also cry at the loss of his precious vase.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'm sure that Grandfather also cried at the loss of his precious vase.
PC Japanese (JP): お祖父さまも、大切な壷が失われたことを、きっと泣くでしょう。
Russian (RU): Я также была уверена, что дедушка тоже будет оплакивать потерю своей драгоценной вазы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu tinha certeza que meu avô também choraria a perda de seu precioso vaso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 爺爺也一定會為失去自己珍愛的壺而哭吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 爷爷也一定会为失去自己珍爱的壶而哭吧。

Umineko Project (UP): I was sure that all of the people who thought fondly of Grandfather would cry too, when they saw him like that.
Steam (ST): I'm sure that all the people who love Grandfather and see him like that will cry.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'm sure that all of the people who valued Grandfather and saw him like that cried.
PC Japanese (JP): それを見て、お祖父さまを大切に思う人たちもみんな、きっと泣くでしょう。
Russian (RU): Уверена, что все люди, любившие дедушку и увидевшие его в таком состоянии, тоже плакали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu tinha certeza que todas as pessoas que tinha carinho por ele também chorariam quando o vissem chorando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看了他這副樣子，愛戴爺爺的人們也都會哭吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看了他这副样子，爱戴爷爷的人们也都会哭吧。

Umineko Project (UP): By just the loss of a single life, the whole world would be filled with so much sadness.
Steam (ST): With the loss of a single life, the whole world can be filled with so much sadness.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By just the loss of a single life, the whole world would be filled with so much sadness.
PC Japanese (JP): たったひとつの命が失われただけで、世界中はこんなにも悲しみに染まるのです。
Russian (RU): Лишь из‐за потери одной жизни весь мир будет полон такой печали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com a perda de uma única vida, o mundo todo iria ser preenchido com muita tristeza.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 僅僅是失去了一條生命，就會把整個世界染成悲傷的顏色。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 仅仅是失去了一条生命，就会把整个世界染成悲伤的颜色。

Umineko Project (UP): ......I cried even more at how terrible that would be.
Steam (ST): ...I cried even more at how terrible that was.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……その恐ろしさに、私はさらに泣きました。
Russian (RU): ......Я заплакала ещё сильнее от того, как ужасно это было.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eu chorei ainda percebendo o quão terrível isso seria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……想到這件事有多麼可怕，我哭得更厲害了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……想到这件事有多么可怕，我哭得更厉害了。

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Beatrice} appeared, and spoke.
Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice} appeared...and spoke.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beatrice appeared, and spoke.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェが現れて、言いました。
Russian (RU): Тут появилась {f:5:Беатриче} и сказала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Beatrice} apareceu e falou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵莉切現身，說道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵莉切现身，说道。

Umineko Project (UP): "Then, Milady. Let us revive this vase with magic. If that will make everyone happy, then the vase and the magic and the spirits...should be happy to lend you their power, and return it to its original form."
Steam (ST): "Then, Milady, let us revive that vase with magic. If that will make everyone happy, the vase and the magic and the spirits... will happily lend you their power and return it to its original form.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Then, Milady. Let us revive that vase with magic. If that will make everyone happy, the vase and the magic and the spirits should be happy to lend you their power, and return it to its original form.
PC Japanese (JP): 「ならばお嬢様。この壷を、魔法で蘇らせましょう。それで皆が幸せになれるなら、壷も魔法も精霊たちも、喜んでその為に力を貸し、元の姿を取り戻すでしょう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ならばお嬢様。この壷を、魔法で蘇らせましょう。それで皆が幸せになれるなら、壷も魔法も精霊たちも、喜んでその為に力を貸し、元の姿を取り戻すでしょう」
Russian (RU): "Что ж, миледи. Давайте возродим эту вазу с помощью магии. Если это сможет всех осчастливить, то ваза, магия и духи будут рады оказать вам свою помощь, дадут вам свою силу, и вернут её в изначальную форму."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Nesse caso, ojou‐sama. Vamos reviver este vaso com magia. Se isso fizer todos felizes, então o vaso, a magia, os espíritos...certamente ficaram felizes em emprestar poder a você, e fazê‐lo retornar a sua forma original."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那麼，小姐。就以魔法來復甦這件壺吧。大家能靠此變得幸福的話，那麼壺、魔法、精靈們，都會樂意為此效勞，取回壺原先的身姿的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那么，小姐。就以魔法来复苏这件壶吧。大家能靠此变得幸福的话，那么壶、魔法、精灵们，都会乐意为此效劳，取回壶原先的身姿的。」

Umineko Project (UP): "Come, Milady. Close your eyes, and say the chant with me..."
Steam (ST): Come, Milady. Close your eyes and chant with me..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Come, Milady. Close your eyes, and say the chant with me..."
PC Japanese (JP): さぁさ、お嬢様。目を閉じて、私と一緒にお唄を詠いましょう…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「さぁさ、お嬢様。目を閉じて、私と一緒にお唄を詠いましょう…」
Russian (RU): "Итак, миледи. Закройте глаза и повторяйте вместе со мной..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Venha, ojou‐sama. Feche seus olhos e recite o encantamento junto comigo..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「來——來，小姐。閉上眼睛，與我一起唱歌吧…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「来——来，小姐。闭上眼睛，与我一起唱歌吧…」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "Come, try closing your eyes. And try to remember. What form did you have? It was surely a very, very beautiful form. Please, show me that form one more time..."
Steam (ST): "Come, try closing your eyes. And try to remember. What form did you have? It was surely a very, very beautiful form. Please, show me that form one more time..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Come, try to close your eyes. And try to remember. What form did you have? It was surely a very, very beautiful form. Please, show me that form one more time..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「さぁさ、目を閉じて御覧なさい。そして思い出して御覧なさい。あなたがどんな姿をしていたのか。それはきっと、とてもとても美しい姿。どうか私に、あの姿をもう一度見せておくれ…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「さぁさ、目を閉じて御覧なさい。そして思い出して御覧なさい。あなたがどんな姿をしていたのか。それはきっと、とてもとても美しい姿。どうか私に、あの姿をもう一度見せておくれ…」
Russian (RU): "Закрой свои глаза и просто вспомни. Какой же формы ваза та была? Наверняка красивой и прекрасной. Так покажи мне вновь её, прошу..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Vamos, experimente fechar seus olhos. E busque recordar. Que forma você possuía? Certamente era uma forma muito, muito bonita. Por favor, mostre‐me essa forma mais uma vez..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「來——來，閉上眼睛。然後想起來吧。你原本是怎樣的身姿呀？那一定是，非常非常漂亮的身姿呢。請再讓我看一次，那美麗的身姿吧…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「来——来，闭上眼睛。然后想起来吧。你原本是怎样的身姿呀？那一定是，非常非常漂亮的身姿呢。请再让我看一次，那美丽的身姿吧…」

Umineko Project (UP): Those words of power powerfully knocked on the door to Hades.
Steam (ST): Those words of power knocked forcefully on the door to the Land of the Dead.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Those words of power forcefully knocked on the door to Hades.
PC Japanese (JP): 力ある言葉が、冥府の扉を力強く叩く。
Russian (RU): Эти слова силы яростно стучали в двери царства Аида.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquelas poderosas palavras bateram às portas de Hades.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 有力的言語重重敲著冥府之門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 有力的言语重重敲着冥府之门。

Umineko Project (UP): Her previous magic had powerfully knocked on the door to Hades in the same way.
Steam (ST): The magic of her old self had performed that same forceful knock.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her previous magic forcefully knocked on the door to Hades in the same way.
PC Japanese (JP): かつての彼女の魔法も、同じように冥府の扉を力強く叩いた。
Russian (RU): Её прошлая магия яростно стучала в двери царства Аида с такой же силой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sua magia anterior havia batido veementemente nas portas de Hades da mesma forma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 曾經的她的魔法，也同樣重重地敲過冥府之門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 曾经的她的魔法，也同样重重地敲过冥府之门。

Umineko Project (UP): ......However, back then, it was horribly violent, ...and earned the displeasure of the peacefully sleeping dead...
Steam (ST): ...However, doing it that way was horribly violent...and earned the displeasure of the peacefully sleeping dead...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......However, that way was horribly violent, ...and earned the displeasure of the peacefully sleeping dead...
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、それはひどく乱暴で、…安らかに眠る死者たちのひんしゅくを買うものだった…。
Russian (RU): ......Стук этот был довольно жесток и вызвал неудовольствие у спящих спокойным сном мёртвых...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Entretanto, naquela oportunidade, havia sido de forma horrível e violenta, ...merecendo o desprazer do falecido que dormia pacificamente...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……然而，那是非常粗暴的，…令安眠的死者們皺眉的蠻行…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……然而，那是非常粗暴的，…令安眠的死者们皱眉的蛮行…。

Umineko Project (UP): However, this time was different. ...It was very powerful, ...but it was very kind and loving.
Steam (ST): But this time was different. ...It was very forceful...and yet gentle and loving.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, this time was different....It was very forceful, ...but it was very gentle and loving.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、今は違う。…とても力強いのに、…とてもやさしくて慈しみのあるもの。
Russian (RU): Однако на этот раз всё было иначе. ...Он был очень сильным, но при этом наполнен состраданием и любовью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, dessa vez foi diferente. ...Era muito poderosa, ...mas gentil e afável na mesma proporção.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，現在可不同。…儘管很是有力，…但還帶有著一份非常溫柔的慈愛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，现在可不同。…尽管很是有力，…但还带有着一份非常温柔的慈爱。

Umineko Project (UP): The dead near the door opened their eyes, ......and called out to the other dead that there was a voice calling for someone to come back.
Steam (ST): The dead near the door opened their eyes... and called out to the others that there was a voice calling for someone to come back.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The dead near the door opened their eyes, ......and called out to the other dead that there was a voice calling for someone to come back.
PC Japanese (JP): 扉の近くの死者たちが目を覚まし、……戻ってくることを呼び掛ける声があることを、他の死者たちに呼び掛ける。
Russian (RU): Мёртвые возле двери открыли свои глаза и окликнули других мёртвых, что явился голос, зовущий кого‐то вернуться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O falecido próximo à porta abriu seus olhos, ......gritando para os outros mortos que aquela era uma voz que chamava alguém de volta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在門附近的死者們睜開眼睛，……紛紛將有呼喚著某人回歸的呼喊聲一事，告知其他死者。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在门附近的死者们睁开眼睛，……纷纷将有呼唤着某人回归的呼喊声一事，告知其他死者。

Umineko Project (UP): ...The sadness of that voice calling from the outside touched the hearts of the dead, and trying to respond as quickly as possible, they searched for Shannon's lost soul...
Steam (ST): ...The sadness of that voice calling from the outside touched the hearts of the dead, and, trying to respond as quickly as possible, they searched for Shannon's lost soul...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …死者たちは、外より呼び掛けるその声の悲しさに胸を打たれ、一刻も早く応えてやろうと、紗音の失われた魂を探す…。
Russian (RU): ...Печаль, звучащая в голосе снаружи, тронула сердца мёртвых, и, пытаясь ответить как можно скорее, они искали потерянную душу Шаннон...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...A tristeza daquela voz chamando através do outro lado tocou o coração do falecido, e buscando responder o mais rápido possível, eles procuraram pela alma perdida de Shannon...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …死者們被外面傳來的呼喊聲中的悲傷所打動，為了爭分奪秒地回應他的呼喊，尋找起了紗音所失去的靈魂…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …死者们被外面传来的呼喊声中的悲伤所打动，为了争分夺秒地回应他的呼喊，寻找起了纱音所失去的灵魂…。

Umineko Project (UP): And then, .........they found it.{n}They found the casket in which Shannon was peacefully sleeping.
Steam (ST): And then, ......they found it. They found the casket in which Shannon was peacefully sleeping.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And then, .........they found it. They found the casket in which Shannon was peacefully sleeping.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、………見つける。安らかに眠る紗音の棺を見つける。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そして、………見つける。{n}安らかに眠る紗音の棺を見つける。
Russian (RU): А затем они нашли её.{n}Они нашли гроб, в котором мирно спала Шаннон.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E então, .........eles a encontraram.{n}Eles encontraram o caixão onde Shannon estava dormindo tranquilamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，………找到了。{n}找到了，紗音安詳沉眠著的棺材。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，………找到了。{n}找到了，纱音安详沉眠着的棺材。

Umineko Project (UP): It truly was Shannon's soul, sleeping in the land of the dead.{n}......Inside a casket that was covered with rose petals frozen with frost, she was sleeping in peace...
Steam (ST): It truly was Shannon's soul, sleeping in the land of the dead. ...Inside the casket that was covered with rose flowers frozen with frost, she was sleeping in peace...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It truly was Shannon's soul, sleeping in the land of the dead.......Inside the casket that was covered with rose flowers frozen with frost, she was sleeping in peace...
PC Japanese (JP): それはまさに、死者の国に眠る紗音の魂そのもの。……霜と凍った薔薇の花で埋められた棺の中で、安らかに眠っている…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それはまさに、死者の国に眠る紗音の魂そのもの。{n}……霜と凍った薔薇の花で埋められた棺の中で、安らかに眠っている…。
Russian (RU): Это действительно была душа Шаннон, спавшей в стране мёртвых.{n}......Внутри гроба, покрытом лепестками роз, замороженных инеем, она покоилась в мире...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era realmente a alma de Shannon, dormindo na terra dos mortos.{n}......Dentro do caixão coberto por pétalas de rosas congeladas, ela estava dormindo em paz...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這正是沉眠於死者國度的，紗音的靈魂。{n}……她在埋於寒霜與結冰的玫瑰花中的棺材裡，安詳地沉睡著…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这正是沉眠于死者国度的，纱音的灵魂。{n}……她在埋于寒霜与结冰的玫瑰花中的棺材里，安详地沉睡着…。

Umineko Project (UP): The dead silently lifted that casket up.
Steam (ST): The dead silently lifted that casket up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The dead silently lifted that casket up.
PC Japanese (JP): 死者たちはその棺を静かに担ぎ上げる。
Russian (RU): Мёртвые молча подняли гроб и понесли его.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O falecido silenciosamente elevou aquele caixão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 死者們靜靜地擔起這副棺材。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 死者们静静地担起这副棺材。

Umineko Project (UP): ...While it looked like a funeral march at a glance, it had the complete opposite meaning.
Steam (ST): ...While at a glance, it looked like a funeral march, it had the complete opposite meaning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...While at a glance, it looked like a funeral march, it had the complete opposite meaning.
PC Japanese (JP): …それは一見、葬送行列に似ていながら、意味はまったく異なるもの。
Russian (RU): ...Хотя на первый взгляд это больше напоминало похоронную процессию, в действительности это имело полностью противоположный смысл.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Apesar de aparentar ser uma marcha funerária a primeira vista, ela possuía um significado completamente oposto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …雖然乍一看，這像是送葬的行列，但其意義卻完全不同。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …虽然乍一看，这像是送葬的行列，但其意义却完全不同。

Umineko Project (UP): It was solemn, but filled with joy.
Steam (ST): It was solemn, but filled with joy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was solemn, but filled with joy.
PC Japanese (JP): 厳かだけれど、喜びに満ちていて。
Russian (RU): Она была мрачна, но при этом наполнена радостью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era solene, mas preenchida pela alegria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 其儘管莊重肅穆，卻也充滿了欣喜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 其尽管庄重肃穆，却也充满了欣喜。

Umineko Project (UP): ...It reminded the long‐forgotten dead...that they continue to be loved even after their deaths, ......and gave them all a warm sense of peace......
Steam (ST): ...The long-forgotten dead were made to remember that they were loved after their deaths, ...and they were all given a warm sense of peace...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...The long-forgotten dead were made to remember that they were loved after their deaths, ......and they were all given a warm sense of peace......
PC Japanese (JP): …忘れ去られて久しい死者たちに、自分たちは死してなお、愛され続けていることを思い出させてくれて、……彼ら全てに温かな安寧を与えるのだ……。
Russian (RU): ...Давно позабытых мёртвых заставили вспомнить, что их продолжали любить после смерти... И все они смогли ощутить тёплое чувство покоя.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Isso recordou os mortos há muito tempo esquecidos...que eles continuavam a ser amados mesmo depois de suas mortes, ......e deu a todos uma calorosa sensação de paz......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …這令被忘卻久矣的死者們，想起了自己死後，也還被人愛著，……這給予了他們全體溫暖的安寧……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …这令被忘却久矣的死者们，想起了自己死后，也还被人爱着，……这给予了他们全体温暖的安宁……。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, ...as though guided by a warm light from the heavens, ...Shannon's body floated up out of the casket...
Steam (ST): Then, ...as though guided by a warm light from the heavens, ...Shannon's body floated up out of the casket...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then..., as though guided by a warm light from the heavens, ...Shannon's body floated up out of the casket...
PC Japanese (JP): そして…、天上よりの温かな光に招かれるように、…棺より紗音の体が、浮かび上がる…。
Russian (RU): Затем, словно ведомые тёплым светом, льющимся с небес... Тело Шаннон выплыло из гроба...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ...como se fosse guiada por uma cálida luz dos céus, ...o corpo de Shannon flutuou para fora do caixão...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後…，就像是被從天上照下的溫暖的光引導著似的，…紗音的身體浮出了棺材…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后…，就像是被从天上照下的温暖的光引导着似的，…纱音的身体浮出了棺材…。

Umineko Project (UP): The dead watched her go. ......They squinted at that warm light, giving their respect to this unknown member of the living, who had continued to hold onto his love for a person even after her death...
Steam (ST): The dead watched her go. ...They squinted at that warm light, offering their respect to this unknown member of the living...who had not lost his love for a person even after their death...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The dead watched her go.......They squinted at that warm light, giving their respect to this unknown member of the living who had continued to hold onto his love for a person even after death...
PC Japanese (JP): 死者たちはそれを見送る。……その温かな光に目を細め、死者への愛を変わらず持ち続けてくれる、見知らぬ生者に敬意を送るのだった…。
Russian (RU): Мёртвые смотрели ей вслед. ......Они, щурясь, глядели на этот тёплый свет, отдавая дань уважения тому неизвестному из мира живых, продолжавшему держаться за своего любимого человека даже после его смерти...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os mortos a observaram ir. ......Eles fecharam os olhos diante daquela calorosa luz, demonstrando seu respeito por aquele desconhecido membro da vida, que continuou a nutrir seu amor por uma pessoa mesmo após a sua morte...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 死者們目送著她。……朝著這道溫暖的光，眯起眼睛，向對死者抱有不變的愛的，素不相識的生者，送去了敬意…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 死者们目送着她。……朝着这道温暖的光，眯起眼睛，向对死者抱有不变的爱的，素不相识的生者，送去了敬意…。

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon's body was sucked into the light in the heavens, and began to disappear...
Steam (ST): Shannon's body was enveloped in the light from the heavens and began to disappear...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon's body was sucked into the light in the heavens and began to disappear...
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音の体が、天上の光の中に、飲み込まれて消えていく…。
Russian (RU): Тело Шаннон засосало в свет в небесах и оно стало исчезать...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O corpo de Shannon foi consumido pela luz dos céus e começou a desaparecer...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音的身體，逐漸被這道光吞沒，慢慢地消失了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音的身体，逐渐被这道光吞没，慢慢地消失了…。

Umineko Project (UP): In the jet‐black darkness of the land of the dead, the faint flickering of gold butterflies could be seen.
Steam (ST): In the jet-black darkness of the land of the dead, the faint flickering of gold butterflies could be seen.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the jet-black darkness of the land of the dead, the faint flickering of gold butterflies could be seen.
PC Japanese (JP): 死者の国の漆黒の闇の中に、わずかに黄金の蝶が瞬いたのが見えた。
Russian (RU): В кромешной как тьме земле мёртвых ещё можно было разглядеть слабое мерцание золотых бабочек.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Na escuridão obsidiana da terra dos mortos, o fraco cintilar de douradas borboletas podia ser visto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在死者國度的漆黑黑暗中，亮起了一瞬黃金蝶閃爍的微小光芒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在死者国度的漆黑黑暗中，亮起了一瞬黄金蝶闪烁的微小光芒。

Umineko Project (UP): ...It reminded them of the gentle stars in the night sky, which they had long forgotten...
Steam (ST): ...It reminded them of the gentle stars in the night sky, which they had long forgotten...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …それは、彼らが忘れて久しい、やさしい夜空の星を思い出させた…。
Russian (RU): ...Это напомнило им о добрых звёздах в ночном небе, о котором они уже давно успели позабыть...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Lembrando a eles as gentis estrelas do céu noturno, no qual há muito tempo haviam esquecido...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …這令他們想起了忘卻已久的，溫柔夜空的星星…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …这令他们想起了忘却已久的，温柔夜空的星星…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): George remembered being told that he must not say anything, and he hurriedly covered his mouth.
Steam (ST): George remembered being told that he must not say anything, and he hurriedly covered his mouth.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治は、声を出してはならないと言われていることを思い出し、慌てて自らの口を塞ぐ。
Russian (RU): Джордж вспомнил, что дал слово ничего говорить и поспешно закрыл рот.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): George lembrou que havia sido ordenado a não dizer nada, e se apressou para cobrir sua boca.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治想起自己被囑咐過“不可出聲”，慌忙地捂住了自己的嘴。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治想起自己被嘱咐过“不可出声”，慌忙地捂住了自己的嘴。

Umineko Project (UP): However, it felt like his heart was trying to jump out of his throat.{n}......Because he had seen Shannon's eyelids shake slightly.
Steam (ST): However, it felt like his heart was trying to jump into his throat. ...Because he had seen Shannon's eyelids shake slightly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, it felt like his heart was trying to jump into his throat.......Because he had seen Shannon's eyelids shake slightly.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、喉から心臓が飛び出そうだった。……紗音の瞼が、わずかに震えたのを見たからだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、喉から心臓が飛び出そうだった。{n}……紗音の瞼が、わずかに震えたのを見たからだ。
Russian (RU): Тем не менее, его сердце готово было буквально выпрыгнуть из горла.{n}......Потому что он увидел, как веки Шаннон слегка зашевелились.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, era como se o seu coração estivesse palpitando em sua garganta.{n}......Por que ele havia visto as pálpebras de Shannon tremerem suavemente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 心臟都快跳出喉嚨了。{n}……因為，他看到了紗音的眼皮微微一顫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 心脏都快跳出喉咙了。{n}……因为，他看到了纱音的眼皮微微一颤。

Umineko Project (UP): And then, ...those eyelids slowly opened. Shannon's eyes were there, but they were still covered in the frost of the land of the dead.
Steam (ST): Then, ...those eyelids slowly opened. Shannon's eyes were there, but they were still wrapped in the fog of the land of the dead.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, ...those eyelids slowly opened. Shannon's eyes were there, but they were still wrapped in the fog of the land of the dead.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、…ゆっくりとその瞼が開く。そこには紗音の瞳があったが、まだ死者の国の霜が降りたままだった。
Russian (RU): И тут... Эти веки медленно открылись. Глаза Шаннон были здесь, но они всё ещё были окутаны туманом земли мёртвых.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E então, ...aquelas pálpebras se abriram lentamente. Os olhos de Shannon estavam lá, mas ainda cobertos pela geada da terra dos mortos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，…其眼皮慢慢睜開。下方紗音的眼珠雖然還結著死者國度的寒霜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，…其眼皮慢慢睁开。下方纱音的眼珠虽然还结着死者国度的寒霜。

Umineko Project (UP): However, ......the warmth of the human world...no. ......The warmth of her loved one, who had called her soul back, slowly dissolved that frost, .........and her eyes gradually regained their sparkle.
Steam (ST): However, ...the human world's warmth... ...No, her lover's warmth, which had called back her soul, slowly dissolved that fog, ......and her eyes gradually regained their sparkle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, ......the human world's, ...no.......The lover's warmth which had called her soul back slowly dissolved that fog, .........and her eyes gradually regained their sparkle.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、……人の世の、…いや。……彼女の魂を呼び戻した想い人の温かさで、ゆっくりと溶かされていき、………次第に、輝きを取り戻していく。
Russian (RU): Однако... человеческий мир... Нет, тепло её возлюбленного, позвавшего её душу обратно, медленно рассеяло этот туман... И её глаза постепенно обрели свой блеск.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Contudo, ......o calor do mundo humano...não. ......O calor daquele que a amava, que chamou sua alma de volta, lentamente dissolveu aquela geada, .........e seus olhos gradualmente foram recuperando seu brilho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，……人世的，…不。……喚回她靈魂的心上人的溫情，慢慢將霜溶化，………令其逐漸取回了神采。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，……人世的，…不。……唤回她灵魂的心上人的温情，慢慢将霜溶化，………令其逐渐取回了神采。

Umineko Project (UP): Then, .........her eyes moved, ...and recognized George.
Steam (ST): Then, ......her eyes moved...and recognized George.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, .........her eyes moved, ...and recognized George.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、………その瞳が動き、…譲治の姿を認める。
Russian (RU): Затем... эти глаза поднялись... И признали фигуру Джорджа.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, .........seus olhos se moveram...e reconheceram George.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，………眼珠轉動，…看清了讓治。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，………眼珠转动，…看清了让治。

Speaker: Shannon
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]

Umineko Project (UP): As her lips shook weakly, ......Shannon definitely said that.
Steam (ST): As her lips shook weakly, ...Shannon definitely said that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音が、弱々しく唇を震わせ、……確かにそう言った。
Russian (RU): Дрожащими губами Шаннон определённо сказала это.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seus lábios se chocaram levemente, ......Shannon definitivamente havia dito aquilo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音柔弱地顫動嘴唇，……的確是說了這個詞。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音柔弱地颤动嘴唇，……的确是说了这个词。

Umineko Project (UP): The words were very faint.{n}So much so that they normally wouldn't even have reached his ears.
Steam (ST): The words were very faint. So much so that they normally wouldn't have reached his ears.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The words were very faint. So much so that they normally wouldn't have reached his ears.
PC Japanese (JP): それは言葉としてはあまりに弱々しい。普通なら耳にも届かないほどに。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それは言葉としてはあまりに弱々しい。{n}普通なら耳にも届かないほどに。
Russian (RU): То были очень тихие слова.{n}Настолько тихие, что в обычных обстоятельствах они не достигли бы его ушей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As palavras eram muito fracas.{n}Tão fracas que normalmente não chegariam aos ouvidos dele.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 作為言語，這實在是過於微弱。{n}一般來說，是不可能傳進人的耳中的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 作为言语，这实在是过于微弱。{n}一般来说，是不可能传进人的耳中的。

Umineko Project (UP): ......However, George clearly heard them.
Steam (ST): ...However, George clearly heard them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、譲治にははっきりと聞き取れた。
Russian (RU): ......Однако Джордж чётко услышал их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Porém, George as ouviu claramente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……然而，讓治卻清清楚楚地聽到了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……然而，让治却清清楚楚地听到了。

Umineko Project (UP): .........He heard his loved one, his fiancée, the one he loved most who should have been dead, call his name once again...
Steam (ST): ......He heard the person he cared for, his fiancée, the one he loved most and who should have been dead, call his name once again...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........He had heard the person of his thoughts, his fiancee, the one he loved most who should have been dead, call his name once again...
PC Japanese (JP): ………死んだはずの想い人が、婚約者が、もっとも愛しい人が、再び自分の名を呼んでくれたのを聞いた…。
Russian (RU): .........Он услышал, как занимающий его мысли человек, его невеста, которую он любил больше всех на свете и которая должна была быть мертва, вновь назвала его имя...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): .........Ele ouviu sua amada mais uma vez, sua amada, aquela que ele tanto amou e que deveria estar morta, chamando pelo seu nome mais uma vez...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ………聽到了本已死去的心上人、未婚妻、最愛之人，再次叫出了自己的名字…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ………听到了本已死去的心上人、未婚妻、最爱之人，再次叫出了自己的名字…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "Shannon, .........Shannon.........can you......recognize me.........?"
Steam (ST): "Shannon, ......Shannon, ...do you... ...know who I am......?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Shannon, .........Shannon............, do you, ......know who I am.........?"
Russian (RU): "Шаннон..... Шаннон... ты... ты ведь знаешь меня?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Shannon, .........Shannon.........você consegue......me reconhecer.........?"

Speaker: Shannon
Steam (ST): "...George-sa...n, ......is this...a dream......?"
Russian (RU): "......Джордж‐са...н... Значит это... сон?.."

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "No. This isn't a dream. ......See, look, ......even if I pinch, you don't wake up."
Steam (ST): "No. This isn't a dream. ...C'mon, see here... ...Even if I pinch you, you won't wake up."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No. This isn't a dream. ......C'mon, look, ......even if I pinch, you don't wake up."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいや。これは夢じゃないよ。……だからほら、……抓っても、醒めないよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いいや。これは夢じゃないよ。……だからほら、……抓っても、醒めないよ」
Russian (RU): "Нет. Это не сон. ......Ну ладно, смотри... Даже если я ущипну, ты не просыпаешься."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não. Isso não é um sonho. ......Viu, ......mesmo se eu beliscá‐la, você não vai acordar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不。這不是夢。……所以，……就算擰一把，也不會醒喲。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不。这不是梦。……所以，……就算拧一把，也不会醒哟。」

Umineko Project (UP): As George said that, he softly pinched Shannon's cheek.
Steam (ST): As George said that, he softly pinched Shannon's cheek.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治はそう言い、紗音の頬をやさしく抓るような仕草をする。
Russian (RU): После того, как Джордж сказал это, он слегка ущипнул Шаннон за щёку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dizendo aquilo, ele gentilmente beliscou a bochecha de Shannon.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治說完後，溫柔地輕輕擰了下紗音的臉蛋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治说完后，温柔地轻轻拧了下纱音的脸蛋。

Umineko Project (UP): ......It was how George had always responded in the past, when Shannon had been surprised by something and had asked if she was dreaming.
Steam (ST): ...It was how George had always responded in the past, when Shannon had been surprised by something and had asked if she was dreaming.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……それはかつて、紗音が何かを驚き、夢かと問う時に必ず譲治が返した仕草。
Russian (RU): ......Джордж всегда делал так в прошлом, когда Шаннон была удивлена чем‐нибудь и спрашивала, не спит ли она.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Era como George sempre a respondia no passado, quando Shannon era surpreendida por algo e perguntava se estava sonhando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……這是以前，紗音因某事感到吃驚，詢問這是不是夢時，讓治必然會還以的動作。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这是以前，纱音因某事感到吃惊，询问这是不是梦时，让治必然会还以的动作。

Umineko Project (UP): When Shannon felt the warm touch of George's finger on her cheek...{n}......And when George realized that the warmth of a living person had already returned to the cheek of his beloved...
Steam (ST): When Shannon felt the warm touch of George's finger on her cheek... ...And when George realized that the warmth of the living had already returned to his beloved person's cheek...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Shannon felt the warm touch of George's finger on her cheek.........And when George realized that the warmth of a living person had already returned to his beloved person's cheek...
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音は、自分の頬に触れた譲治の指の温かな感触に。……そして譲治は、愛しい人の頬に、すでに生きる者の温もりが戻っていることに。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 紗音は、自分の頬に触れた譲治の指の温かな感触に。{n}……そして譲治は、愛しい人の頬に、すでに生きる者の温もりが戻っていることに。
Russian (RU): Когда Шаннон ощутила тёплое прикосновение пальцев Джорджа к своей щеке...{n}......И когда Джордж понял, что тепло живого человека вернулось к щеке его возлюбленной...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando Shannon sentiu o caloroso toque do dedo de George em sua bochecha...{n}......E quando George percebeu que o calor dos vivos havia retornado à bochecha da pessoa que ele tanto amava...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 紗音是為，觸摸自己臉龐的讓治手指的溫暖感觸。{n}……而讓治是為，深愛之人的臉龐，已重新有了活人的體溫。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 纱音是为，触摸自己脸庞的让治手指的温暖感触。{n}……而让治是为，深爱之人的脸庞，已重新有了活人的体温。

Umineko Project (UP): ......They both cried.
Steam (ST): ...They both cried.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……二人は涙する。
Russian (RU): ......Они оба зарыдали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ambos choraram.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……而一同流下了眼淚。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……而一同流下了眼泪。

Umineko Project (UP): ...With what words should a pair of lovers separated by death celebrate their reunion? ......The words of the human world are not enough to celebrate that.
Steam (ST): ...What words should a pair of lovers separated by death celebrate with when they are reunited? ...The words of the human world are not enough.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...What words should a pair of lovers separated by death celebrate with when they are reunited?......The words of the human world are not enough to celebrate that.
PC Japanese (JP): …死別した愛し合う二人は、その再会をどんな言葉で祝しあうのだろう。……それを祝いあう言葉は、人の世の狭き言葉では足りない。
Russian (RU): ...Какими словами может пара влюблённых, разлученных смертью, отпраздновать своё воссоединение? ......Всех слов человеческого мира будет недостаточно, чтобы отпраздновать это.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Com quais palavras um par de amantes separados pela morte deveria celebrar seu reencontro? ......Nenhuma palavra do mundo humano era suficiente para celebrar aquele momento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …經過死別的相愛的兩人，會用怎樣的言詞來共慶這次重逢呢？……人世的狹隘詞彙是不足以慶祝此的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …经过死别的相爱的两人，会用怎样的言词来共庆这次重逢呢？……人世的狭隘词汇是不足以庆祝此的。

Umineko Project (UP): In short, they had no need of the words of this world...
Steam (ST): In short, they had no need of the words of this world...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In short, they had no need of the words of this world...
PC Japanese (JP): つまり、人の世の言葉など、二人には何の必要もない…。
Russian (RU): Проще говоря, они не нуждались в словах этого мира...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que significa que eles não necessitavam das palavras desse mundo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 換言之，他們兩人不需要任何人世的話語…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 换言之，他们两人不需要任何人世的话语…。

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon sat up, and the two of them simply wordlessly hugged each other.
Steam (ST): George simply hugged Shannon, who was sitting up, without talking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): George simply hugged Shannon, who was sitting up, without talking.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治は、上体を起こした紗音と、ただ言葉もなく抱き締め合った。
Russian (RU): Джордж просто обнял Шаннон, присев рядом и не говоря ни слова.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon sentou e, sem palavras, os dois apenas se abraçaram.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治與坐起了上半身的紗音，只是無言地緊緊抱在了一起。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治与坐起了上半身的纱音，只是无言地紧紧抱在了一起。

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon still didn't have much strength in her, and putting her arms around George's back took all she had, ......so George hugged her tightly to make up for that.
Steam (ST): Shannon's strength was still feeble...and putting her arms around George's back took all she had, ...so George hugged her tightly to make up for that.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Shannon's strength was still feeble, and putting her arms around George's back took all she had, ......so George hugged her tightly to make up for that.
PC Japanese (JP): 紗音の力はまだ弱々しくて、譲治の背中に手を回すのが精一杯だったから、……譲治はその分、きつく抱き締めた。
Russian (RU): Шаннон всё ещё была слаба, так что когда она обвила руками спину Джорджа, это лишило её последних сил, поэтому Джордж крепко обнял её, исправив это.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Shannon ainda não tinha muita força, e colocar seus braços ao redor de George era tudo o que ela podia fazer, ......então George a abraçou fortemente para compensar aquilo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 由於紗音還很虛弱，她費盡了全力，才勉強把手放在了讓治的後背上，……所以，讓治連她那份一起，用力抱緊了她。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 由于纱音还很虚弱，她费尽了全力，才勉强把手放在了让治的后背上，……所以，让治连她那份一起，用力抱紧了她。

Umineko Project (UP): To stop her from ever again going to a place beyond his reach, he hugged her so tightly, and yet so gently......
Steam (ST): To stop each other from going once more to a place the other's hand couldn't reach, they hugged each other so tightly, and yet so gently...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To stop each other from going once more to a place the other's hand couldn't reach, they hugged each other very tightly, and yet very gently......
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女が二度と自分の手の届かないところに行ってしまわないように、きつくきつく、だけれどもやさしくやさしく、抱き締めた……。
Russian (RU): Чтобы больше безвозвратно не разлучиться, друг с другом, они крепко и в то же время очень мягко обнимали друг друга...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para impedi‐la de ir novamente para um lugar longe de seu alcance, ele a abraçou com muita força, ainda assim de forma gentil......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就像是再也不讓她去自己無法觸及之處似的，雖然很是用力，卻又非常非常溫柔地，抱緊了她……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就像是再也不让她去自己无法触及之处似的，虽然很是用力，却又非常非常温柔地，抱紧了她……。

Umineko Project (UP): Shannon's fingers curled around George's back, ......and on her ring finger indeed shone the engagement ring George had given her.
Steam (ST): As Shannon's fingers curled around George's back, ...on her ring finger, the engagement ring George had given her definitely shone.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On Shannon's fingers, which curled around George's back, ......on her ring finger, the engagement ring George had given her definitely shone.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治の背中に回す紗音の指には、……その薬指に、譲治が贈った婚約指輪が確かに光っていた。
Russian (RU): На пальцах Шаннон, обнимавших спину Джорджа... На её безымянном пальце засверкало обручальное кольцо, подаренное ей Джорджем.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os dedos de Shannon se curvaram em volta das costas de George, ......em seu dedo reluzia o anel de noivado que George havia dado a ela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 抱住讓治後背的紗音的那隻手的，……無名指上，真切閃爍著讓治送給她的訂婚戒指的光芒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 抱住让治后背的纱音的那只手的，……无名指上，真切闪烁着让治送给她的订婚戒指的光芒。

Umineko Project (UP): That strong sparkle was absolutely not the sparkle of diamond alone.{n}......There was, without doubt, a magical power there that only the two lovers could possibly feel.
Steam (ST): That strong glint certainly wasn't just the sparkle of diamond. ...There definitely was a magical power that only the two lovers could possibly feel.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That strong sparkle definitely wasn't only the sparkle of diamond.......There definitely was a magical power that only the two lovers could possibly feel.
PC Japanese (JP): その強い輝きは、決してダイヤの輝きだけではない。……愛する二人にしか感じ得ない魔力が、確かにあった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その強い輝きは、決してダイヤの輝きだけではない。{n}……愛する二人にしか感じ得ない魔力が、確かにあった。
Russian (RU): Этот сильный блеск определённо не был сиянием одного лишь алмаза.{n}......Вне всяких сомнений, это была та сила магии, которую могли ощутить лишь двое влюблённых.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquele brilho intenso de forma alguma era apenas o brilho do diamante.{n}......Lá havia, sem dúvida alguma, um poder mágico que apenas os dois amantes poderiam sentir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這份強健的光輝，絕非僅僅來自鑽石。{n}……其中的確宿有著，只有相愛的兩人才能感受得到的魔力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这份强健的光辉，绝非仅仅来自钻石。{n}……其中的确宿有着，只有相爱的两人才能感受得到的魔力。

Umineko Project (UP): It was because that strong light existed...that they had been able to find her casket in the land of the dead.
Steam (ST): It was because that strong light existed...that they had been able to find her casket in the land of the dead.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was because that strong light existed, ...that they had been able to find her casket in the land of the dead.
PC Japanese (JP): その強い輝きがあったからこそ、…死者の国で、彼女の棺は見つけてもらえたのだ。
Russian (RU): Лишь благодаря этому самому свету они смогли найти её гроб в земле мёртвых.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era porque aquela forte luz existia...que eles foram capazes de encontrar seu caixão em meio à terra dos mortos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 正是因為有這強健的光輝，…才得以在死者的國度中，找到她的棺木。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 正是因为有这强健的光辉，…才得以在死者的国度中，找到她的棺木。

Umineko Project (UP): Beato understood.
Steam (ST): Beato understood.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beato understood.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Beato compreendeu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵明白了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵明白了。

Umineko Project (UP): ......That ring, ......no.
Steam (ST): ...That ring, ...no.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……是這戒指，……不。

Steam (ST): ......The feelings of the pair, embodied in that ring, were a miracle made real.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ............The feelings of the pair, embodied in that ring, were a miracle made real.
PC Japanese (JP): …………指輪の形をした、二人の想いが、この奇跡を実現させたのだ。
Russian (RU): ............Чувства пары, воплощённые в этом кольце, смогли сделать чудо реальностью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ............Os sentimentos do casal, na forma daquele anel, haviam criado esse milagre.

Chinese Simplified (CN): …………是化为戒指形状的，两人间的爱恋，实现了这个奇迹。

Umineko Project (UP): In that moment, George had definitely used magic. Beato had done nothing more than help him along. That magic had a magical power that could only reside in those who knew of the importance of life and trying their hardest.
Steam (ST): In that moment, George definitely used magic. Beato had done nothing more than help him along. That magic had a power that could only reside in those who knew of the importance of life, who knew what it meant to try with all one's might.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In that moment, George had definitely used magic. Beato had done nothing more than help him along. That magic had a magical power that could only reside in those who knew of the importance of life and trying their hardest.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治はあの瞬間、確かに魔法を使った。ベアトはその手助けをしたに過ぎない。その魔法には、命の大切さと一生懸命を知る者にしか宿しえない魔力があった。
Russian (RU): В этот момент Джордж определённо сумел использовать магию. Беато лишь оказала ему в этом помощь. То была мощь магической силы, доступной лишь тем, кто понимал, насколько дорога жизнь и старался изо всех сил.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquele momento, George definitivamente havia usado magia. Beato nada mais fez do que ajudá‐lo. Aquela magia detinha um poder mágico que poderia residir apenas naqueles que conheciam a importância da vida e davam o seu melhor para vivê‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 讓治在那一瞬間，的確是使用了魔法。貝阿朵只不過是在打下手。這魔法具有著，只有懂得生命的寶貴與拚命努力的意義之人，才會宿上的魔力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 让治在那一瞬间，的确是使用了魔法。贝阿朵只不过是在打下手。这魔法具有着，只有懂得生命的宝贵与拼命努力的意义之人，才会宿上的魔力。

Umineko Project (UP): It was the power of a miracle that an Endless Witch could not know, ......that only the power of the {i:finite} could give rise to.
Steam (ST): It was the power of a miracle, one that the Endless Witch couldn't possibly know of... A miracle that only the power of the finite could give rise to.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was the power of a miracle, which the Endless Witch could not know, ......and that only limited power could give rise to.

Russian (RU): Это была сила чуда, которого Ведьме Бесконечности не было дано постичь, и которое могла вызвать лишь {i:ограниченная} сила.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era o poder de um milagre que a Bruxa do Infinito não era capaz de compreender, ......era algo que apenas o poder do {i:finito} poderia dar forma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是無限的魔女不可能明白的，……僅為有限之力才能引發的，奇跡之力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是无限的魔女不可能明白的，……仅为有限之力才能引发的，奇迹之力。

Umineko Project (UP): By now, she had no choice but to accept it. ......She had to accept that true magic, true magical power...
Steam (ST): By now, she had no choice but to accept it. ...She had to accept that true magic, true magical power...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By now, she had no choice but to accept it.......She had to accept that true magic, true magical power...
PC Japanese (JP): 今こそ認めざるを得ない。……本当の魔法とは、魔力とは。
Russian (RU): Теперь ей ничего не оставалось, кроме как признать это. ......Она была вынуждена признать, что истинная магия, истинная магическая сила...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora, ela não tinha escolha a não ser reconhecer isto. ......Ela tinha que aceitar aquela magia verdadeira, aquele poder mágico verdadeiro...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在此刻，不得不承認。……不得不承認，所謂真正的魔法、魔力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在此刻，不得不承认。……不得不承认，所谓真正的魔法、魔力。

Umineko Project (UP): ...existed in the place farthest away from she who called herself a Great Witch.
Steam (ST): ...Exists in the place furthest away from she who called herself a Great Witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...exists in the place farthest away from she who called herself a Great Witch.
PC Japanese (JP): …大魔女を名乗った彼女と、もっとも遠く離れたところにあったことを、認めなければならない。
Russian (RU): Существует в том месте, которого ей, Ведьме Бесконечности, никогда не достигнуть.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...existia em um lugar muito distante dela que se declarava uma Grande Bruxa.

Chinese Simplified (CN): …处在距自称是大魔女的她而言的，最为遥远的位置。

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………贝阿朵莉切…夫人……」

Steam (ST): "...She brought you back to life... Thank you, {f:5:Beatrice}...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......She brought you back to life... Thank you, Beatrice...!"

PC Japanese (JP): 「いいや。妾は何もできなかった。……紗音を蘇らせたのは、そなたの魔力。そなたの魔法。…………奇跡を成し遂げる右代宮の血、…確かに見届けさせてもらったぞ。」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…うむ。………妾など足元にも及ばぬほどの、凄まじき魔力であったぞ。……妾など、まだまだ見習いの域を出ぬか。…今こそ身の程を知ろうぞ」

Umineko Project (UP): Beato staggered backwards.{n}...Her physical strength was clearly exhausted.

Umineko Project (UP): She had humbly said that George's power alone had revived Shannon, but Beato had also used all of her magical and physical strength.
Steam (ST): She had humbly said that George's power alone had revived Shannon, but Beato had also used all of her magical and physical strength.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had humbly said that George's power alone had revived Shannon, but Beato had also used all of her magical and physical strength.
PC Japanese (JP): 譲治の力だけで蘇らせたと謙遜しているが、ベアトも全身の魔力と体力を使い切っていた。
Russian (RU): Она скромно отметила, что своей силой Джордж в одиночку смог воскресить Шаннон, но и Беато полностью израсходовала всю свою магическую и физическую силу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela humildemente disse que o poder de George sozinho havia revivido Shannon, mas Beato também usou de toda sua magia e força física.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 儘管她自謙地說著“只是靠著讓治之力復活的紗音”，但貝阿朵也用盡了全身的魔力與體力。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 尽管她自谦地说着“只是靠着让治之力复活的纱音”，但贝阿朵也用尽了全身的魔力与体力。

Umineko Project (UP): ...And she reflected upon how difficult it was to revive a single one of these lives, which she had toyed with however she wanted in the past.
Steam (ST): ...And she reflected upon how difficult it was to revive a single life, something she'd been able to play around with however she wanted to in the past.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...And she reflected upon how difficult it was to revive a single life, which she had been able to play with however she wanted in the past.
PC Japanese (JP): …そして、かつて、自由自在に弄んでいた命を、たったひとつ蘇らせるだけで、これほどの重みがあるのかと、…それを噛み締めている。
Russian (RU): ...И она задумалась о той разнице, насколько трудно было возродить единственную жизнь, с которой она могла свободно развлекаться в прошлом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...E refletiu sobre o quão difícil era reviver uma única daquelas vidas, nas quais ela brincou o quanto quis no passado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …然後，她細細思索起了，僅僅是復甦了一條以前曾自由玩弄過的生命，竟有著此等沉重的分量嗎…？
Chinese Simplified (CN): …然后，她细细思索起了，仅仅是复苏了一条以前曾自由玩弄过的生命，竟有着此等沉重的分量吗…？

Umineko Project (UP): The couple kept each other in their tight embrace, and showed no signs of letting go. ...Feelings that couldn't be communicated with a billion words were thus communicated between them...
Steam (ST): The couple kept on embracing each other tightly. ...By doing that, those feelings that couldn't be communicated with a billion words...were shared...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The couple kept on embracing each other tightly....By doing that, their feelings that couldn't be communicated with a billion words, were communicated...
PC Japanese (JP): 二人はいつまでも、力強く抱擁を交し合う。…百億の言葉でも伝えられない気持ちを、そうして伝え合っていた…。
Russian (RU): Джордж с Шаннон продолжали крепко обнимать друг друга. ...Так их чувства, которые невозможно было передать даже миллиардом слов, доходили друг до друга...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O casal se manteve em seu forte abraço, sem demonstrar sinais de que se soltariam. ...Sentimentos que não poderiam ser expressados nem mesmo com um bilhão de palavras eram o que os faziam se comunicar...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 兩人久久地用力擁抱著對方。…以此來互相傳達，數以百億計的言語都無法傳達出來的心意…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 两人久久地用力拥抱着对方。…以此来互相传达，数以百亿计的言语都无法传达出来的心意…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya George
Umineko Project (UP): "Thank you, {f:5:Beatrice}. ...We are in your debt..."
Steam (ST): "Thank you, {f:5:Beatrice}. ...We're in your debt..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Thank you, Beatrice. ...We are in your debt..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ありがとう、ベアトリーチェ。…君は僕たちの恩人だ…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ありがとう、ベアトリーチェ。…君は僕たちの恩人だ…」
Russian (RU): "Спасибо тебе, {f:5:Беатриче}. ...Мы в долгу перед тобой..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Obrigado, {f:5:Beatrice}. ...Temos um débito com você..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「謝謝，貝阿朵莉切。…您是我們的恩人…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「谢谢，贝阿朵莉切。…您是我们的恩人…」

Speaker: Shannon
Umineko Project (UP): "...Thank you very much, {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama. ......I will never forget that it was you who let me meet with George again."
Steam (ST): "...Thank you very much, {f:5:Beatrice}-sama. ...I'll never forget the debt I owe you for bringing me to George again."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Thank you very much, Beatrice-sama. ......I definitely will not forget that it was you who let me meet with George again."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…ありがとうございます、ベアトリーチェさま。……再び譲治さまに会わせて下さったこのご恩を、…決して忘れません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…ありがとうございます、ベアトリーチェさま。……再び譲治さまに会わせて下さったこのご恩を、…決して忘れません」
Russian (RU): "...Большое вам спасибо, {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама. ......Я не забуду того, что именно благодаря вам я снова смогла встретиться с Джорджем."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Muito obrigada, {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama. ......Eu nunca irei esquecer que foi você quem me permitiu encontrar com o George mais uma vez."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…非常感謝，貝阿朵莉切夫人。……我決不會忘記，您令我與讓治少爺再次相會的恩情。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…非常感谢，贝阿朵莉切夫人。……我决不会忘记，您令我与让治少爷再次相会的恩情。」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "......Enough, enough. Being thanked by a pair of lovers is far too embarrassing for one who has been feared as an extreme savage. ......Don't worry...about me. ...Take all the time you want.........celebrating your reunion together........."
Steam (ST): "...Stop that, stop that. Being thanked by a pair of lovers is far too embarrassing for one who has been feared as a monster of a person. ...Don't worry...about me. ...Celebrate your reunion together......to the fullest......"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Stop that, stop that. Being thanked by a pair of lovers is far too embarrassing for one who has been feared as an extreme heretic. ......Don't worry, ...about me. ...Celebrate your reunion together, .........as much as you can........."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……よせよせ。愛し合う二人に感謝されては、外道の極みと恐れられた妾にはくすぐった過ぎるというものよ。……妾のことは、…気にするな。…存分に、………再会を、祝い合え………。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……よせよせ。愛し合う二人に感謝されては、外道の極みと恐れられた妾にはくすぐった過ぎるというものよ。……妾のことは、…気にするな。…存分に、………再会を、祝い合え………」
Russian (RU): "......Перестаньте, будет вам. Принимать благодарности от пары влюблённых слишком неловко для той, кого боялись как крайнюю еретичку. ......Не беспокойтесь... обо мне. ...Празднуйте вместе своё воссоединение..... так сильно, как можете..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Já basta. Ser agradecida por um par de amantes é embaraçoso demais para quem já foi temida por sua extrema selvageria. ......Não se...preocupem comigo. ...Levem o tempo que vocês desejarem.........celebrando o reencontro de vocês........."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……不必不必。相愛的兩人的道謝，會令因邪惡至極而被恐懼著的妾身，渾身起雞皮疙瘩哦。……不必在意，…妾身。…盡情地，………共慶，再會吧………」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……不必不必。相爱的两人的道谢，会令因邪恶至极而被恐惧着的妾身，浑身起鸡皮疙瘩哦。……不必在意，…妾身。…尽情地，………共庆，再会吧………」

Umineko Project (UP): Beato, who was leaning her back against the wall, slid down the wall, and sat. How many centuries had it been since she had last grown this tired from using magic?
Steam (ST): Beato, who was leaning with her back against the wall, slid down the wall and sat. How many centuries had it been since she last grew this tired from using magic?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beato, who was leaning on her back against the wall, slid down with the wall still on her back, and sat. How many centuries had it been since she had last grown this tired from using magic?
PC Japanese (JP): 壁に背中をもたれ掛けるベアトは、そのままずるりと壁を背負ったまま、座り込む。こんなにも魔法で疲労したのは何百年ぶりなのか。
Russian (RU): Беато, опиравшаяся спиной об стену, окончательно сползла по ней и села. Как много веков назад это было, когда она так уставала от использования магии?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Beato, que estava com suas costas contra a parede, foi escorregando e sentou. Quantos séculos faz desde a última vez em que ela ficou tão exausta por usar magia?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 背靠著牆的貝阿朵，就這麼緊挨牆壁坐了下去。是有幾百年，沒因為使用魔法累到這個地步過了呢？

Umineko Project (UP): ......Probably, not since the time I first succeeded in magic.
Steam (ST): ...I probably haven't been this tired since the time I first succeeded in magic.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I probably haven't been this tired since the time I first succeeded in magic.
PC Japanese (JP): ……多分、初めて魔法を成し遂げた時以来。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Provavelmente, nunca desde a época em que obteve sucesso em sua primeira magia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……大概得追溯到初次達成魔法吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……大概得追溯到初次达成魔法吧。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Oh, but didn't I kill that Teacher who praised me myself?

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Don't be naive, Beatrice.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Não seja ingênua, {f:5:Beatrice}.

Steam (ST): "...Finally. ...It seems you've finally remembered how to use magic."

Umineko Project (UP): "...............My whole head...feels parched and suffocated, ......and I can't even think, let alone remember... ...Wait, ...didn't I kill you? You shouldn't be appearing..."
Steam (ST): "......My head...feels parched and suffocated, ...and I can't even remember... ...More importantly, ...didn't I kill you? You shouldn't be appearing..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............My head...feels parched and suffocated, ......and I can't even remember......More importantly, ...didn't I kill you? You shouldn't be appearing..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……………頭ン中、酸欠でカラカラで、……思い出すもヘチマもねェぜ…。…それよりアンタ、…殺したじゃねぇかよ。現れるんじゃねぇよ…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……………頭ン中、酸欠でカラカラで、……思い出すもヘチマもねェぜ…。…それよりアンタ、…殺したじゃねぇかよ。現れるんじゃねぇよ…」
Russian (RU): "............У меня в голове... похоже, всё перепуталось и забылось... и я даже не могу вспомнить... ...Что важнее... разве я не убила вас? Вас ведь не должно здесь быть..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...............Minha cabeça...estava ressecada e sufocada, ......não conseguindo sequer pensar, muito menos lembrar... ...Espera, ...eu não havia matado você? Você não deveria aparecer..."

Speaker: {f:5:Virgilia}
Umineko Project (UP): "You have let me live until now. That is why I can appear like this. ......However, I did not come here to pat you on the head."
Steam (ST): "You are still allowing me to live even now. That is why I can appear like this. ...However, I did not come just to pat your head."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "You have let me live until now. That is why I can appear like this. ......However, I did not come just to pat your head."

Russian (RU): "Ты всё же позволила мне жить дальше. Именно поэтому я смогла появиться здесь. ......Хотя я здесь не просто для того, чтобы погладить тебя по голове."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você me permitiu viver até agora. É por isso que eu posso aparecer assim. ......Porém, eu não vim aqui para passar a mão na sua cabeça."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你还让我活着哟。所以，我能像这样出现。……不过说到底，我并不是来抚摸你的脑袋的。」

Umineko Project (UP): "......Did you come here just to sneer at how pathetic I am? ......And after all this time, after retiring as a witch and everything, ...if I sit here and have my head patted, I'll be the laughingstock of the other witches......"
